intro: Wahlenbergia linarioides f. subhirsuta, commonly known as the hairy linaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The subspecies subhirsuta is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a unique texture compared to other Wahlenbergia species. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care in gardens.
